content: BOSTON  Feb 12 Hewlett-Packard Co will become the largest company to hold an online-only annual shareholder meeting this March  joining a trend toward virtual conferences that some activists worry keeps CEOs off the hotseat.
name: HP Inc
title: HP moves annual meeting online-only as CEO face time fades

title: Market Chatter- Corporate finance press digest

content: LONDON Britain's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) has closed its investigation into the ill-fated sale of Autonomy to Hewlett-Packard Co in 2011  saying there was not enough evidence to secure a conviction of the software firm's former executives.
name: HP Inc
title: UK's Serious Fraud Office ends investigation into HP-Autonomy deal

content: * SFO cedes jurisdiction of parts of case to U.S. authorities   (Adds HP  former Autonomy CEO Lynch reaction)
name: HP Inc
title: UPDATE 2-UK's Serious Fraud Office ends investigation into HP-Autonomy deal

content: LONDON  Jan 19 HP says "remains committed" to holding Autonomy's former management accountable  co-operating with U.S. Probe
name: HP Inc
title: HP says "committed" to holding Autonomy's former management accountable

content: AUTONOMY FORMER CEO MIKE LYNCH WELCOMES SFO'S DECISION TO CLOSE INVESTIGATION ON HP-AUTONOMY ACQUISITION
name: HP Inc
title: BRIEF-Autonomy's former CEO Lynch welcomes end to SFO probe

content: LONDON  Jan 19 Britain's Serious Fraud Office said it had closed its investigation into the ill-fated sale of British IT firm Autonomy to Hewlett-Packard in 2011  saying there was insufficient evidence for a realistic prospect of conviction.
name: HP Inc
title: RPT-UK's Serious Fraud Office closes investigation into HP-Autonomy deal
